document_data.name: Jewelers' Congress
document_data.mainbody: The '''Jewelers' Congress''' was a guildhall in [[Daggerford]] that was shared by the local Jeweler's Guild and the Whitesmiths' Guild.
document_data.Location: The guildhall was located at the junction of the [[Farmer's Road]] and [[Duke's Way]] in central Daggerford.{{Cite interactive atlas}}
document_data.Structure: The building resembled something of a massive vault, akin to this that could be found within the walls of a bank. Each of the building's entryways were heavily reinforced and it well-guarded by both the local constables as well as the [[Daggerford militia]].
document_data.Activities:
In addition to being a meeting place for two guilds, the Jewelers' Congress served as a holding area for gems and precious metals.

Guild members could store their valuables within the guildhall, for a small fee based on the inherent value of what was being safeguarded.
